read_annotations[source]

read_annotations(files_source)

Read annotations from folder structure representing the categories. files_source: the path to the folder containing subfolders as category label with source files return: the annotations

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

write_annotations[source]

write_annotations(target_path, annotations)

Write annotations to folder structure representing the categories. The category folder will is created, if not exist, and corresponding files are copied into the labeled folder. target_path: the target path to create labeled folder structure into annotations: the annotations to write

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Helper Methods

{% raw %}

configure_logging[source]

configure_logging(logging_level=20)

Configures logging for the system.

:param logging_level: The logging level to use.

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Run from command line

To run the data-set builder from command line, use the following command: python -m mlcore.annotation.folder_category_adapter [parameters]

The following parameters are supported:

  • [files_source]: the path to the folder containing subfolders as category label with source files (e.g.: imagesets/segmentation/car_damage/trainval)
